00042 #include <linux/rtc.h>
00043 #include <fromsys.h>
00044 #include <banal.h>
00045 #include <splitfields.h>
00046 #include <datatypes.h>

00052 //========================================================================
00053 
00054 #define L_KEY_DOWN        (01 << 00)
00055 #define R_KEY_DOWN        (01 << 01)
00056 
00057 #define NO_TIME_LEFTS_SCHED     (-2)
00058 #define NO_ELEMENT              (-1)
00059 #define DIT                      (0)
00060 #define DAH                      (1)
00061 #define MODE_A                   (0)
00062 #define MODE_B                   (1)
00063 #define NO_PADDLE_SQUEEZE        (0)
00064 #define PADDLES_SQUEEZED         (1)
00065 #define PADDLES_RELEASED         (2)
00066 #define NO_DELAY                 (0)
00067 #define CHAR_SPACING_DELAY       (1)
00068 #define WORD_SPACING_DELAY       (2)
00069 #define DEBOUNCE_BUF_MAX_SIZE   (30)
00070 
00071 //========================================================================
00072 
00073 typedef struct _keyer_state
00074 {
00075     struct
00076     {
00077         BOOLEAN iambic,         // iambic or straight
00078                 mdlmdB,         // set true if mode B
00079                 revpdl;         // paddles reversed
00080         struct
00081         {
00082             BOOLEAN dit,
00083                     dah;
00084         } memory;               // set both true for mode B
00085         struct
00086         {
00087             BOOLEAN khar,
00088                     word;
00089         } autospace;
00090     } flag;
00091     int debounce,               // # seconds to read paddles
00092         mode,                   // 0 = mode A, 1 = mode B
00093         weight;                 // 15 -> 85%
00094     double wpm;                 // for iambic keyer
00095 } KeyerStateInfo, *KeyerState;
00096 
00097 extern KeyerState newKeyerState( void );
00098 extern void delKeyerState( KeyerState ks );
00099 
00100 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00101 
00102 typedef struct _keyer_logic
00103 {
00104     struct
00105     {
00106         BOOLEAN init;
00107         struct
00108         {
00109             BOOLEAN dit,
00110                     dah;
00111         } prev;
00112     } flag;
00113     struct
00114     {
00115         BOOLEAN altrn,          // insert alternate element
00116                 psqam;          // paddles squeezed after mid-element
00117         int curr,               // -1 = nothing, 0 = dit, 1 = dah
00118             iamb,               //  0 = none, 1 = squeezed, 2 = released
00119             last;               // -1 = nothing, 0 = dit, 1 = dah
00120     } element;
00121     struct
00122     {
00123         double beep,
00124                dlay,
00125                elem,
00126                midl;
00127     } time_left;
00128     int dlay_type;              // 0 = none, 1 = interchar, 2 = interword
00129 } KeyerLogicInfo, *KeyerLogic;
00130 
00131 extern KeyerLogic newKeyerLogic( void );
00132 extern void delKeyerLogic( KeyerLogic kl );
00133 
00134 extern BOOLEAN klogic( KeyerLogic kl, BOOLEAN dit, BOOLEAN dah, double wpm,
00135                        int iambicmode, BOOLEAN need_midelemodeB,
00136                        BOOLEAN want_dit_mem, BOOLEAN want_dah_mem,
00137                        BOOLEAN autocharspacing, BOOLEAN autowordspacing,
00138                        int weight, double ticklen );
00139 
00140 //========================================================================
00141 //========================================================================
00142 //========================================================================
00143 
00144 #define SAMP_RATE (48000)
00145 
00146 // # times key is sampled per sec
00147 #define RTC_RATE (64)
00148 
00149 // # samples generated during 1 clock tick at RTC_RATE
00150 #define TONE_SIZE (SAMP_RATE / RTC_RATE)
00151 
00152 // ring buffer size
00153 #define RING_SIZE (01 << 022)
00154 
00155 KeyerState ks;
00156 KeyerLogic kl;
00157 
00158 pthread_t poller,
00159           play,
00160           key,
00161           update;
00162 sem_t poll_action,
00163       clock_fired,
00164       keyer_started,
00165       update_ok;
00166 int poll_status;
00167 
00168 int fdser,
00169     fdrtc;
00170 
00171 jack_client_t *client;
00172 jack_port_t *lport,
00173            *rport;
00174 jack_ringbuffer_t *lring,
00175                  *rring;
00176 jack_nframes_t size;
00177 
00178 CWToneGen gen;
00179 BOOLEAN playing = FALSE,
00180     iambic = FALSE;
00181 double wpm = 18.0,
00182     freq = 750.0,
00183     ramp = 5.0,
00184     gain = -3.0;

00187 //========================================================================
00188 //========================================================================
00189 
00190 /* Get most recent input port status,
00191    do debouncing,
00192    then return the key state */
00193 
00194 BOOLEAN read_straight_key( KeyerState ks )
00195 {
00196     int i,
00197         j,
00198         status;
00199     static BOOLEAN keystate = 0;
00200     static int debounce_buf_i = 0,
00201         debounce_buf[DEBOUNCE_BUF_MAX_SIZE];
00202 
00203     /* Get the key state */
00204     sem_wait( &poll_action );
00205     status = poll_status;
00206     poll_status = 0;
00207     //sem_post(&poll_action);
00208 
00209     debounce_buf[debounce_buf_i] = status & ( L_KEY_DOWN | R_KEY_DOWN );
00210     debounce_buf_i++;
00211 
00212     /* If the debounce buffer is full,
00213        determine the state of the key */
00214     if ( debounce_buf_i >= ks->debounce )
00215     {
00216         debounce_buf_i = 0;
00217 
00218         j = 0;
00219         for ( i = 0; i < ks->debounce; i++ )
00220             if ( debounce_buf[i] )
00221                 j++;
00222         keystate = ( j > ks->debounce / 2 ) ? 1 : 0;
00223     }
00224 
00225     return keystate;
00226 }
00227 
00228 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00229 
00230 /* Get most recent input port status,
00231    do debouncing,
00232    emulate a straight key,
00233    then return the emulated key state */
00234 
00235 BOOLEAN read_iambic_key( KeyerState ks, KeyerLogic kl, double ticklen )
00236 {
00237     int i,
00238         j,
00239         status;
00240     static BOOLEAN dah_debounce_buf[DEBOUNCE_BUF_MAX_SIZE],
00241             dit_debounce_buf[DEBOUNCE_BUF_MAX_SIZE];
00242     static int dah = 0,
00243         debounce_buf_i = 0,
00244         dit = 0;
00245 
00246     /* Get the key states */
00247     sem_wait( &poll_action );
00248     status = poll_status;
00249     poll_status = 0;
00250     //sem_post(&poll_action);
00251 
00252     if ( ks->flag.revpdl )
00253     {
00254         dah_debounce_buf[debounce_buf_i] = status & L_KEY_DOWN;
00255         dit_debounce_buf[debounce_buf_i] = status & R_KEY_DOWN;
00256     }
00257     else
00258     {
00259         dit_debounce_buf[debounce_buf_i] = status & R_KEY_DOWN;
00260         dah_debounce_buf[debounce_buf_i] = status & L_KEY_DOWN;
00261     }
00262     debounce_buf_i++;
00263 
00264     /* If the debounce buffer is full, determine the state of the keys */
00265     if ( debounce_buf_i >= ks->debounce )
00266     {
00267 
00268         j = 0;
00269         for ( i = 0; i < ks->debounce; i++ )
00270             if ( dah_debounce_buf[i] )
00271                 j++;
00272         dah = ( j > ks->debounce / 2 ) ? 1 : 0;
00273 
00274         j = 0;
00275         for ( i = 0; i < ks->debounce; i++ )
00276             if ( dit_debounce_buf[i] )
00277                 j++;
00278         dit = ( j > ks->debounce / 2 ) ? 1 : 0;
00279 
00280         debounce_buf_i = 0;
00281     }
00282 
00283     return klogic( kl, dit, dah, ks->wpm, ks->mode, ks->flag.mdlmdB,
00284                    ks->flag.memory.dit, ks->flag.memory.dah,
00285                    ks->flag.autospace.khar, ks->flag.autospace.word,
00286                    ks->weight, ticklen );
00287 }
00288 
00289 //========================================================================
00290 
00291 BOOLEAN klogic( KeyerLogic kl, BOOLEAN dit, BOOLEAN dah, double wpm,
00292                 int iambicmode, BOOLEAN need_midelemodeB,
00293                 BOOLEAN want_dit_mem, BOOLEAN want_dah_mem,
00294                 BOOLEAN autocharspacing, BOOLEAN autowordspacing, int weight,
00295                 double ticklen )
00296 {
00297 
00298     double ditlen = 1200 / wpm;
00299     int set_which_ele_time_left = NO_TIME_LEFTS_SCHED;
00300 
00301     /* Do we need to initialize the keyer? */
00302     if ( !kl->flag.init )
00303     {
00304         kl->flag.prev.dit = dit;
00305         kl->flag.prev.dah = dah;
00306         kl->element.last = kl->element.curr = NO_ELEMENT;
00307         kl->element.iamb = NO_PADDLE_SQUEEZE;
00308         kl->element.psqam = 0;
00309         kl->element.altrn = 0;
00310         kl->time_left.midl = kl->time_left.beep = kl->time_left.elem = 0;
00311         kl->time_left.dlay = 0;
00312         kl->dlay_type = NO_DELAY;
00313         kl->flag.init = 1;
00314     }
00315 
00316     /* Decrement the time_lefts */
00317     kl->time_left.dlay -= kl->time_left.dlay > 0 ? ticklen : 0;
00318     if ( kl->time_left.dlay <= 0 )
00319     {
00320         /* If nothing is scheduled to play,
00321            and we just did a character space delay,
00322            and we're doing auto word spacing,
00323            then pause for a word space,
00324            otherwise resume the normal element time_left countdowns */
00325         if ( kl->time_left.elem <= 0 && kl->dlay_type == CHAR_SPACING_DELAY &&
00326              autowordspacing )
00327         {
00328             kl->time_left.dlay = ditlen * 4;
00329             kl->dlay_type = WORD_SPACING_DELAY;
00330         }
00331         else
00332         {
00333             kl->dlay_type = NO_DELAY;
00334             kl->time_left.midl -= kl->time_left.midl > 0 ? ticklen : 0;
00335             kl->time_left.beep -= kl->time_left.beep > 0 ? ticklen : 0;
00336             kl->time_left.elem -= kl->time_left.elem > 0 ? ticklen : 0;
00337         }
00338     }
00339 
00340     /* Are both paddles squeezed? */
00341     if ( dit && dah )
00342     {
00343         kl->element.iamb = PADDLES_SQUEEZED;
00344         /* Are the paddles squeezed past the middle of the element? */
00345         if ( kl->time_left.midl <= 0 )
00346             kl->element.psqam = 1;
00347     }
00348     else if ( !dit && !dah && kl->element.iamb == PADDLES_SQUEEZED )
00349         /* Are both paddles released and we had gotten a squeeze in this element? */
00350         kl->element.iamb = PADDLES_RELEASED;
00351 
00352     /* Is the current element finished? */
00353     if ( kl->time_left.elem <= 0 && kl->element.curr != NO_ELEMENT )
00354     {
00355         kl->element.last = kl->element.curr;
00356 
00357         /* Should we insert an alternate element? */
00358         if ( ( ( dit && dah ) ||
00359                ( kl->element.altrn && kl->element.iamb != PADDLES_RELEASED )
00360                || ( kl->element.iamb == PADDLES_RELEASED &&
00361                     iambicmode == MODE_B && ( !need_midelemodeB ||
00362                                               kl->element.psqam ) ) ) )
00363         {
00364             if ( kl->element.last == DAH )
00365                 set_which_ele_time_left = kl->element.curr = DIT;
00366             else
00367                 set_which_ele_time_left = kl->element.curr = DAH;
00368 
00369         }
00370         else
00371         {
00372             /* No more element */
00373             kl->element.curr = NO_ELEMENT;
00374             /* Do we do automatic character spacing? */
00375             if ( autocharspacing && !dit && !dah )
00376             {
00377                 kl->time_left.dlay = ditlen * 2;
00378                 kl->dlay_type = CHAR_SPACING_DELAY;
00379             }
00380         }
00381 
00382         kl->element.altrn = 0;
00383         kl->element.iamb = NO_PADDLE_SQUEEZE;
00384         kl->element.psqam = 0;
00385     }
00386 
00387     /* Is an element not currently being played? */
00388     if ( kl->element.curr == NO_ELEMENT )
00389     {
00390         if ( dah )              /* Dah paddle down? */
00391             set_which_ele_time_left = kl->element.curr = DAH;
00392         else if ( dit )         /* Dit paddle down? */
00393             set_which_ele_time_left = kl->element.curr = DIT;
00394     }
00395 
00396     /* Take the dah memory request into account */
00397     if ( kl->element.curr == DIT && !kl->flag.prev.dah && dah &&
00398          want_dah_mem )
00399         kl->element.altrn = 1;
00400 
00401     /* Take the dit memory request into account */
00402     if ( kl->element.curr == DAH && !kl->flag.prev.dit && dit &&
00403          want_dit_mem )
00404         kl->element.altrn = 1;
00405 
00406     /* If we had a dit or dah scheduled for after a delay,
00407        and both paddles are up before the end of the delay,
00408        and we have not requested dit or dah memory,
00409        forget it
00410        NB can't happen in full mode B */
00411 
00412     if ( kl->time_left.dlay > 0 && !dit && !dah &&
00413          ( ( kl->element.curr == DIT && !want_dit_mem ) ||
00414            ( kl->element.curr == DAH && !want_dah_mem ) ) )
00415         set_which_ele_time_left = kl->element.curr = NO_ELEMENT;
00416 
00417     /* Set element time_lefts, if needed */
00418     switch ( set_which_ele_time_left )
00419     {
00420     case NO_ELEMENT:           /* Cancel any element */
00421         kl->time_left.beep = 0;
00422         kl->time_left.midl = 0;
00423         kl->time_left.elem = 0;
00424         break;
00425 
00426     case DIT:                  /* Schedule a dit */
00427         kl->time_left.beep = ( ditlen * ( double ) weight ) / 50;
00428         kl->time_left.midl = kl->time_left.beep / 2;
00429         kl->time_left.elem = ditlen * 2;
00430         break;
00431 
00432     case DAH:                  /* Schedule a dah */
00433         kl->time_left.beep = ( ditlen * ( double ) weight ) / 50 + ditlen * 2;
00434         kl->time_left.midl = kl->time_left.beep / 2;
00435         kl->time_left.elem = ditlen * 4;
00436         break;
00437     }
00438 
00439     kl->flag.prev.dit = dit;
00440     kl->flag.prev.dah = dah;
00441 
00442     return kl->time_left.beep > 0 && kl->time_left.dlay <= 0;
00443 }
00444 
00445 KeyerState newKeyerState( void )
00446 {
00447     return ( KeyerState ) safealloc( 1, sizeof( KeyerStateInfo ),
00448                                      "newKeyerState" );
00449 }
00450 
00451 void delKeyerState( KeyerState ks )
00452 {
00453     safefree( ( char * ) ks );
00454 }
00455 
00456 KeyerLogic newKeyerLogic( void )
00457 {
00458     return ( KeyerLogic ) safealloc( 1, sizeof( KeyerLogicInfo ),
00459                                      "newKeyerLogic" );
00460 }
00461 
00462 void delKeyerLogic( KeyerLogic kl )
00463 {
00464     safefree( ( char * ) kl );
00465 }

00467 //========================================================================
00468 
00469 void jack_ringbuffer_clear( jack_ringbuffer_t * ring, int nbytes )
00470 {
00471     int i;
00472     char zero = 0;
00473 
00474     for ( i = 0; i < nbytes; i++ )
00475         jack_ringbuffer_write( ring, &zero, 1 );
00476 }
00477 
00478 void jack_ringbuffer_restart( jack_ringbuffer_t * ring, int nbytes )
00479 {
00480     jack_ringbuffer_reset( ring );
00481     jack_ringbuffer_clear( ring, nbytes );
00482 }
00483 
00484 //------------------------------------------------------------
00485 
00486 // generated tone -> output ringbuffer
00487 void send_tone( void )
00488 {
00489     if ( jack_ringbuffer_write_space( lring ) < TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) )
00490     {
00491         write( 2, "overrun tone\n", 13 );
00492         jack_ringbuffer_restart( lring, TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) );
00493         jack_ringbuffer_restart( rring, TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) );
00494     }
00495     else
00496     {
00497         int i;
00498 
00499         for ( i = 0; i < gen->size; i++ )
00500         {
00501             float l = CXBreal( gen->buf, i ),
00502                 r = CXBimag( gen->buf, i );
00503             jack_ringbuffer_write( lring, ( char * ) &l, sizeof( float ) );
00504             jack_ringbuffer_write( rring, ( char * ) &r, sizeof( float ) );
00505         }
00506     }
00507 }
00508 
00509 // silence -> output ringbuffer
00510 void send_silence( void )
00511 {
00512     if ( jack_ringbuffer_write_space( lring ) < TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) )
00513     {
00514         write( 2, "overrun zero\n", 13 );
00515         jack_ringbuffer_restart( lring, TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) );
00516         jack_ringbuffer_restart( rring, TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) );
00517     }
00518     else
00519     {
00520         int i;
00521 
00522         for ( i = 0; i < gen->size; i++ )
00523         {
00524             float zero = 0.0;
00525             jack_ringbuffer_write( lring, ( char * ) &zero, sizeof( float ) );
00526             jack_ringbuffer_write( rring, ( char * ) &zero, sizeof( float ) );
00527         }
00528     }
00529 }
00530 
00531 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00532 
00533 // sound/silence generation
00534 // tone turned on/off asynchronously
00535 
00536 void sound_thread( void )
00537 {
00538     for ( ;; )
00539     {
00540         sem_wait( &clock_fired );
00541 
00542         if ( playing )
00543         {
00544             // CWTone keeps playing for awhile after it's turned off,
00545             // in order to allow for a decay envelope;
00546             // returns FALSE when it's actually done.
00547             playing = CWTone( gen );
00548             send_tone(  );
00549         }
00550         else
00551         {
00552             send_silence(  );
00553             // only let updates run when we've just generated silence
00554             sem_post( &update_ok );
00555         }
00556     }
00557 
00558     pthread_exit( 0 );
00559 }
00560 
00561 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00562 
00563 void poll_thread( void )
00564 {
00565     struct timespec req,
00566              rem;
00567 
00568     req.tv_sec = 0;
00569     req.tv_nsec = 1000000;
00570     for ( ;; )
00571     {
00572         int status;
00573 
00574         nanosleep( &req, &rem );
00575         if ( ioctl( fdser, TIOCMGET, &status ) != -1 )
00576         {
00577             //sem_wait(&poll_action);
00578             if ( status & TIOCM_DSR )
00579                 poll_status |= L_KEY_DOWN;
00580             if ( status & TIOCM_CTS )
00581                 poll_status |= R_KEY_DOWN;
00582             sem_post( &poll_action );
00583         }
00584     }
00585     pthread_exit( 0 );
00586 }
00587 
00588 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00589 
00590 // basic heartbeat
00591 // returns actual dur in msec since last tick;
00592 // uses Linux rtc interrupts.
00593 // other strategies will work too, so long as they
00594 // provide a measurable delay in msec.
00595 
00596 double timed_delay( void )
00597 {
00598     double del;
00599     unsigned long data;
00600     if ( read( fdrtc, &data, sizeof( unsigned long ) ) == -1 )
00601     {
00602         perror( "read" );
00603         exit( 1 );
00604     }
00605     del = ( data >> 010 ) * 1000 / ( double ) RTC_RATE;
00606     return del;
00607 }
00608 
00609 // key down? (real or via keyer logic)
00610 
00611 BOOLEAN read_key( double del )
00612 {
00613     if ( iambic )
00614         return read_iambic_key( ks, kl, del );
00615     else
00616         return read_straight_key( ks );
00617 }
00618 
00619 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00620 
00621 // main keyer loop
00622 
00623 void key_thread( void )
00624 {
00625 
00626     sem_wait( &keyer_started );
00627 
00628     for ( ;; )
00629     {
00630         double del = timed_delay(  );
00631         BOOLEAN keydown = read_key( del );
00632 
00633         if ( !playing && keydown )
00634             CWToneOn( gen ), playing = TRUE;
00635         else if ( playing && !keydown )
00636             CWToneOff( gen );
00637 
00638         sem_post( &clock_fired );
00639     }
00640 
00641     pthread_exit( 0 );
00642 }
00643 
00644 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00645 
00646 // update keyer parameters via text input from stdin
00647 // <wpm xxx>  -> set keyer speed to xxx
00648 // <gain xxx> -> set gain to xxx (dB)
00649 // <freq xxx> -> set freq to xxx
00650 // <ramp xxx> -> set attack/decay times to xxx ms
00651 // <quit>     -> terminate keyer
00652 
00653 #define MAX_ESC (512)
00654 #define ESC_L '<'
00655 #define ESC_R '>'
00656 
00657 void update_thread( void )
00658 {
00659     for ( ;; )
00660     {
00661         int c;
00662 
00663         // get or wait for next input char
00664         if ( ( c = getchar(  ) ) == EOF )
00665             goto finish;
00666 
00667         // if we see the beginning of a command,
00668         if ( c == ESC_L )
00669         {
00670             int i = 0;
00671             char buf[MAX_ESC];
00672 
00673             // gather up the remainder
00674             while ( ( c = getchar(  ) ) != EOF )
00675             {
00676                 if ( c == ESC_R )
00677                     break;
00678                 buf[i] = c;
00679                 if ( ++i >= ( MAX_ESC - 1 ) )
00680                     break;
00681             }
00682             if ( c == EOF )
00683                 goto finish;
00684             buf[i] = 0;
00685 
00686             // wait until changes are safe
00687             sem_wait( &update_ok );
00688 
00689             if ( !strncmp( buf, "wpm", 3 ) )
00690                 ks->wpm = wpm = atof( buf + 3 );
00691             else if ( !strncmp( buf, "ramp", 4 ) )
00692             {
00693                 ramp = atof( buf + 4 );
00694                 setCWToneGenVals( gen, gain, freq, ramp, ramp );
00695             }
00696             else if ( !strncmp( buf, "freq", 4 ) )
00697             {
00698                 freq = atof( buf + 4 );
00699                 setCWToneGenVals( gen, gain, freq, ramp, ramp );
00700             }
00701             else if ( !strncmp( buf, "gain", 4 ) )
00702             {
00703                 gain = atof( buf + 4 );
00704                 setCWToneGenVals( gen, gain, freq, ramp, ramp );
00705             }
00706             else if ( !strncmp( buf, "quit", 4 ) )
00707                 goto finish;
00708 
00709         }                       // otherwise go around again
00710     }
00711 
00712     // we saw an EOF or quit; kill other threads and exit neatly
00713 
00714   finish:
00715     pthread_cancel( poller );
00716     pthread_cancel( play );
00717     pthread_cancel( key );
00718     pthread_exit( 0 );
00719 }
00720 
00721 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00722 
00723 PRIVATE void jack_xrun( void *arg )
00724 {
00725     char *str = "xrun";
00726 
00727     write( 2, str, strlen( str ) );
00728 }
00729 
00730 PRIVATE void jack_shutdown( void *arg )
00731 {
00732 }
00733 
00734 PRIVATE void jack_callback( jack_nframes_t nframes, void *arg )
00735 {
00736     float *lp,
00737          *rp;
00738     int nbytes = nframes * sizeof( float );
00739 
00740     if ( nframes == size )
00741     {
00742         // output: copy from ring to port
00743         lp = ( float * ) jack_port_get_buffer( lport, nframes );
00744         rp = ( float * ) jack_port_get_buffer( rport, nframes );
00745         if ( jack_ringbuffer_read_space( lring ) >= nbytes )
00746         {
00747             jack_ringbuffer_read( lring, ( char * ) lp, nbytes );
00748             jack_ringbuffer_read( rring, ( char * ) rp, nbytes );
00749         }
00750         else
00751         {                       // rb pathology
00752             memset( ( char * ) lp, 0, nbytes );
00753             memset( ( char * ) rp, 0, nbytes );
00754             jack_ringbuffer_reset( lring );
00755             jack_ringbuffer_reset( rring );
00756             jack_ringbuffer_clear( lring, TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) );
00757             jack_ringbuffer_clear( rring, TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) );
00758             //write(2, "underrun\n", 9); 
00759         }
00760     }
00761 }
00762 
00763 int main( int argc, char **argv )
00764 {
00765     int i;
00766     char *serialdev = "/dev/ttyS0",
00767         *clockdev = "/dev/rtc";
00768     int serstatus;
00769 
00770     for ( i = 1; i < argc; i++ )
00771         if ( argv[i][0] == '-' )
00772             switch ( argv[i][1] )
00773             {
00774             case 'f':
00775                 freq = atof( argv[++i] );
00776                 break;
00777             case 'i':
00778                 iambic = TRUE;
00779                 break;
00780             case 'g':
00781                 gain = atof( argv[++i] );
00782                 break;
00783             case 'r':
00784                 ramp = atof( argv[++i] );
00785                 break;
00786             case 'w':
00787                 wpm = atof( argv[++i] );
00788                 break;
00789             default:
00790                 fprintf( stderr,
00791                          "iambic-keyer [-i] [-w wpm] [-g gain_dB] [-r ramp_ms]\n" );
00792                 exit( 1 );
00793             }
00794         else
00795             break;
00796 
00797     if ( i < argc )
00798     {
00799         if ( !freopen( argv[i], "r", stdin ) )
00800             perror( argv[i] ), exit( 1 );
00801         i++;
00802     }
00803 
00804     //------------------------------------------------------------
00805 
00806     gen = newCWToneGen( gain, freq, ramp, ramp, TONE_SIZE, 48000.0 );
00807 
00808     //------------------------------------------------------------
00809 
00810     kl = newKeyerLogic(  );
00811     ks = newKeyerState(  );
00812     ks->flag.iambic = TRUE;
00813     ks->flag.revpdl = TRUE;
00814     // set On by default; straight key never sees them,
00815     // mode A users are on their own
00816     ks->flag.mdlmdB = ks->flag.memory.dit = ks->flag.memory.dah = TRUE;
00817     ks->flag.autospace.khar = ks->flag.autospace.word = FALSE;
00818     ks->debounce = 1;
00819     ks->mode = MODE_B;
00820     ks->weight = 50;
00821     ks->wpm = wpm;
00822 
00823     //------------------------------------------------------------
00824 
00825     if ( !( client = jack_client_new( "ikyr" ) ) )
00826         fprintf( stderr, "can't make client -- jack not running?\n" ),
00827             exit( 1 );
00828     jack_set_process_callback( client, ( void * ) jack_callback, 0 );
00829     jack_on_shutdown( client, ( void * ) jack_shutdown, 0 );
00830     jack_set_xrun_callback( client, ( void * ) jack_xrun, 0 );
00831     size = jack_get_buffer_size( client );
00832     lport =
00833         jack_port_register( client, "ol", JACK_DEFAULT_AUDIO_TYPE,
00834                             JackPortIsOutput, 0 );
00835     rport =
00836         jack_port_register( client, "or", JACK_DEFAULT_AUDIO_TYPE,
00837                             JackPortIsOutput, 0 );
00838     lring = jack_ringbuffer_create( RING_SIZE );
00839     rring = jack_ringbuffer_create( RING_SIZE );
00840     jack_ringbuffer_clear( lring, TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) );
00841     jack_ringbuffer_clear( rring, TONE_SIZE * sizeof( float ) );
00842 
00843     //------------------------------------------------------------
00844 
00845     // key
00846     if ( ( fdser = open( serialdev, O_WRONLY ) ) == -1 )
00847     {
00848         fprintf( stderr, "cannot open serial device %s", serialdev );
00849         exit( 1 );
00850     }
00851     if ( ioctl( fdser, TIOCMGET, &serstatus ) == -1 )
00852     {
00853         close( fdser );
00854         fprintf( stderr, "cannot get serial device status" );
00855         exit( 1 );
00856     }
00857     serstatus |= TIOCM_DTR;
00858     if ( ioctl( fdser, TIOCMSET, &serstatus ) == -1 )
00859     {
00860         close( fdser );
00861         fprintf( stderr, "cannot set serial device status" );
00862         exit( 1 );
00863     }
00864 
00865     // rtc
00866     if ( ( fdrtc = open( clockdev, O_RDONLY ) ) == -1 )
00867     {
00868         perror( clockdev );
00869         exit( 1 );
00870     }
00871     if ( ioctl( fdrtc, RTC_IRQP_SET, RTC_RATE ) == -1 )
00872     {
00873         perror( "ioctl irqp" );
00874         exit( 1 );
00875     }
00876     if ( ioctl( fdrtc, RTC_PIE_ON, 0 ) == -1 )
00877     {
00878         perror( "ioctl pie on" );
00879         exit( 1 );
00880     }
00881 
00882     //------------------------------------------------------------
00883 
00884     sem_init( &poll_action, 0, 0 );
00885     sem_init( &clock_fired, 0, 0 );
00886     sem_init( &keyer_started, 0, 0 );
00887     sem_init( &update_ok, 0, 0 );
00888     pthread_create( &poller, 0, ( void * ) poll_thread, 0 );
00889     pthread_create( &play, 0, ( void * ) sound_thread, 0 );
00890     pthread_create( &key, 0, ( void * ) key_thread, 0 );
00891     pthread_create( &update, 0, ( void * ) update_thread, 0 );
00892 
00893     //------------------------------------------------------------
00894 
00895     jack_activate( client );
00896     {
00897         const char **ports;
00898 
00899         if ( !
00900              ( ports =
00901                jack_get_ports( client, 0, 0,
00902                                JackPortIsPhysical | JackPortIsInput ) ) )
00903         {
00904             fprintf( stderr, "can't find any physical playback ports\n" );
00905             exit( 1 );
00906         }
00907         if ( jack_connect( client, jack_port_name( lport ), ports[0] ) )
00908         {
00909             fprintf( stderr, "can't connect left output\n" );
00910             exit( 1 );
00911         }
00912         if ( jack_connect( client, jack_port_name( rport ), ports[1] ) )
00913         {
00914             fprintf( stderr, "can't connect left output\n" );
00915             exit( 1 );
00916         }
00917         free( ports );
00918     }
00919 
00920     //sem_post(&poll_action);
00921     sem_post( &keyer_started );
00922 
00923     pthread_join( poller, 0 );
00924     pthread_join( play, 0 );
00925     pthread_join( key, 0 );
00926     pthread_join( update, 0 );
00927     jack_client_close( client );
00928 
00929     //------------------------------------------------------------
00930 
00931     if ( ioctl( fdrtc, RTC_PIE_OFF, 0 ) == -1 )
00932     {
00933         perror( "ioctl pie off" );
00934         exit( 1 );
00935     }
00936     close( fdrtc );
00937     close( fdser );
00938 
00939     jack_ringbuffer_free( lring );
00940     jack_ringbuffer_free( rring );
00941 
00942     sem_destroy( &poll_action );
00943     sem_destroy( &clock_fired );
00944     sem_destroy( &keyer_started );
00945 
00946     delCWToneGen( gen );
00947     delKeyerState( ks );
00948     delKeyerLogic( kl );
00949 
00950     //------------------------------------------------------------
00951 
00952     exit( 0 );
00953 }
Generated on Thu Apr 5 14:11:30 2007 for DttSp by  1.5.1
